Proposal
Screening Opinion: construct hybrid on farm anaerobic digestion plant to treat existing agricultural waste and rotational agricultural crops together with commercial food waste streams
Erection of single storey classroom and resource space with circulation and toilets
Retrospective application for change of use to waste transfer station
Change of use from importation, short term storage, shredding and distribution of green waste for use as a soil improver for agricultural to a waste wood shredding operation
Retrospective application for continued siting of a single temporary classroom (Ref 70099) for use as a playgroup

Amendment of Condition 4 of SDNPA Consent 20661/049 relating to vehicle size, type and no. of movements with no increase in tonnage of food waste and farmyard manure transported to the site from that permitted under Condition 25 of HCC Consent 20661/048
Lawful Use Certificate for waste transfer station with associated skip hire business
Variation of condition 4 of Planning permission 26326/011 (the demountable unit proposed to be erected has increased in size)
Application to vary condition 1 of planning permission F22689/002/FUL to extend the working hours
Removal of existing asbestos cement sheeting with new kingspan composite sheeting to both walls and roof with new box gutters and downpipes

Provision of an additional modular single storey buildng for office use by Hampshire County Council and contractor's staff for a minimum period of five years, provision of additional surfaced areas for staff parking
Permanent retention of the clay storage shed
Waste Transfer Station
Continued siting for double temporary modular building on site for a further four years
Erection of new demountable office unit and ancillary works including the laying out of 16 car parking spaces, 3 HGV parking spaces, fencing and security gates

Change of use (with associated building modifications) from existing builders storage depot to a waste recycling facility to accept and process commercial and industrial waste (including the use of a waste picking station and trommel) on industrial land at the former sewage works off Waterbrook Road, Alton.
Change of use to allow previously extracted clay to be used for brickmaking and landscaping
Erection of 2.2m galvanised steel fencing to areas highlighted in plan
Change of use of a farm track to an access to land at Selborne Brickworks
Upgrade to existing Wastewater Treatment works including new Ferric Dosing Kiosk and Effluent Monitoring Kiosk
